maml:description.maml:para: Helper for calling the OktaApi. Mainly used internally.
This calls the API and returns the object or error messages. You can use this to call APIs that are not yet in this module.

maml:Description.maml:para: Additional part of Uri to call, after base.
The HTTP method to use
The string version of the body to send for post, put, patch
The API token. Calls Get-OktaApiToken with this value so if blank will use value from Set-OktaOption, or environment, if they exist.
The base API Uri. Calls Get-OktaBaseUri with this value so if blank will use value from Set-OktaOption, or environment, if they exist.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Set to return raw content instead of converting from JSON to objects
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Set to get the next page from a previous call (if one exists)
Set if a non-Get call is ok to get 404, otherwise non-Get 404 will result in an error.
The string version of the body to send for post, put, patch
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The HTTP method to use
The API token. Calls Get-OktaApiToken with this value so if blank will use value from Set-OktaOption, or environment, if they exist.
The base API Uri. Calls Get-OktaBaseUri with this value so if blank will use value from Set-OktaOption, or environment, if they exist.
Set to return raw content instead of converting from JSON to objects
Additional part of Uri to call, after base.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Set to get the next page from a previous call (if one exists)
Set if a non-Get call is ok to get 404, otherwise non-Get 404 will result in an error.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-OktaApi -RelativeUri "apps?filter=user.id+eq+%2200upwxy3icQiHJ3HN0h7%22+or+status+eq+%22ACTIVE%22&expand=user%2F00upwxy3icQiHJ3HN0h7&limit=25" -Verbose

dev:remarks.maml:para: This was lifted from the browser's dev tools to figure out how it was getting a user's apps. This was then turned into Get-OktaUserApplication

Description

Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Audience value for the AuthorizationServer

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-OktaAuthorizationServer -Name RelianceApi -Audience "http://cccis.com/reliance/api" -Issuer "http:/cccis.com/reliance"

maml:description.maml:para: Add a user for an Authentication Provider
For users automatically added via an Authentication Provider, this allows you to add them before the first login. So you can add them to groups and apps, etc. Group Rules can do something similar.

maml:Description.maml:para: First name
Last name
Email address
Login, defaults to Email
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Optional array of groups to add the user to
Directory instance name as the name property for ACTIVE_DIRECTORY or LDAP providers.
Type of Authentication Provider, use tab to see valid values
Set to Activate (Enable) to use on add
If Activate is set, for user to change password at next login.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Email address
First name
Last name
Login, defaults to Email
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Optional array of groups to add the user to
Directory instance name as the name property for ACTIVE_DIRECTORY or LDAP providers.
Type of Authentication Provider, use tab to see valid values
Set to Activate (Enable) to use on add
If Activate is set, for user to change password at next login.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-OktaAuthProviderUser -FirstName Fred -LastName Flintstone -Email fflintstone@myco.com -Type FEDERATION -name Corporate-AD

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add's domain user fflintstone@myco.com to Okta.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-OktaClaim -AuthorizationServerId ausoqi2fqgcUpYHBS4x6 -Name appName -ValueType EXPRESSION -ClaimType RESOURCE -Value app.profile.appName

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-OktaClaim -AuthorizationServerId ausoqi2fqgcUpYHBS4x6 -Name test -ValueType EXPRESSION -ClaimType RESOURCE -Value app.profile.appName -Verbose -Scopes "access_token"
